page.title: 06Shopping in Tetsworth
page.content: Once there were many different shops and five public houses in Tetsworth. Gradually they closed until there were only 2 shops and 2 pubs left. The butcher's shop closed down in 1983 and last shop closed this year when the shopkeeper retired. We found out that many villagers are affected by the closing of the shop. Our parents have transport and shop elsewhere so are only affected a little. We can get sweets and drinks from the Post Office.For the people who do not have their own transport there are buses running to the nearest towns. Every Wednesday a lorry comes at which people can shop because it's a grocer's shop on wheels. We think the village should have a shop for the people without transport and for the old people who use it as a meeting place and somewhere to have a chat.
